These valuation techniques maximise the use of observable market data where it is available and rely as little as possible on entity specific estimates. If all significant inputs required for evaluating the fair value of a financial instrument are observable, the instrument is included in level 1.

If all significant inputs required for evaluating the fair value of a financial instrument are observable, the instrument is included in level 3.

results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

Bell Media's capital expenditures at BCE increased by $16.6 million for the year, up 0.3% from 2018. This represented a decrease of $3.4 million compared to 2018. Bell Media had a capital intensity ratio of 16.9% for the year, down 0.3% from 2018. Capital spending in the year reflected the following:
• Bell Media reduced capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology.
• A modest reduction in capital spending at Bell Media of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts.

The increase was primarily driven by an increase in gross margin across all APAC and EMEA regions and a $3.3 million increase in gross margin in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. These increases were partially offset by a decrease in gross margin in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. In addition, there was a favorable impact of $7.6 million due to foreign currency exchange primarily due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.
results.csv_string_response:
Film and Electrolytic
The film and electrolytic segment of our reportable segment experienced a net sales increase of $19.7 million, or 10.8% during the fiscal year 2017 compared to the same fiscal year in fiscal year 2018. This increase in net sales was primarily due to an increase in net sales of $19.7 million, or 10.8% in the distributor channel of the APAC and EMEA regions, as well as an increase in net sales of $3.3 million in the OEM channel of the EMEA region and a $4.2 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. In addition, there was a favorable impact of $7.6 million from foreign currency exchange primarily due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.

These increases were partially offset by a decrease in net sales of $1.2 million in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. results.question: What was the change in the percentage to net sales for segment operating income (loss) between 2017 and 2018?
results.markdown_table_response: The percentage change in net sales to operating income (loss) for the Film and Electrolytic segment of our reportable segment in fiscal year 2018 was $19.7 million. The change in operating income (loss) was driven by an increase in operating income in the Film and Electrolytic segment of our reportable segment of $13.7 million. The increase in operating income was primarily driven by an increase in operating income in the distributor channel across all regions of APAC and EMEA, as well as the OEM channel of the APAC region, and an increase in operating income in the EMS channel of the APAC region.
